thread.title: Detroit News predictions: Lions vs. Cardinals
thread.title_full: Detroit News predictions: Lions vs. Cardinals

author: detroitnews.com
title: Detroit News predictions: Lions vs. Cardinals
text:
Carson Palmer (Photo: Christian Petersen) 
Josh Katzenstein, John Niyo and Bob Wojnowski of The Detroit News predict the outcome of Sunday's Lions-Cardinals game. 
Josh Katzenstein: As was the case against the Seahawks, the Cardinals are better than the Lions at just about every position. The return of DeAndre Levy should help, but this won't be the game the Lions offense finds its groove, which is the only way to turn things around. Cardinals 23-15 
John Niyo: The protection was a bit better against the Seahawks, but the production still isn't with this offense. And the Lions had better put up some points because this Cardinals team will make an aggressive defense pay with big plays in the passing game. The home crowd won't have much patience, either, so an early score would do wonders. Lions 27-24 
Bob Wojnowski: The Cardinals have the right formula â€” play defense and trust a savvy quarterback, Carson Palmer, to make the right throws. The winless Lions have one antidote, and that's their pass rush. Ziggy Ansah led a fierce attack that sacked Seahawks QB Russell Wilson six times. If they can duplicate that, they should hit the immobile Palmer often. It's beyond desperation time now, and at home, the Lions will show it. Lions 27-20
